coSensorHero.title: CO SENSOR
coSensorHero.description: Prana Air CO sensor is made with precision and fineness for both industrial-grade and consumer-grade safety monitoring. The sensor is based on electrochemical technology for highly toxic CO gas.
coSensorHero.descriptions: Advanced carbon monoxide detection for comprehensive safety monitoring.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: The Prana Air CO sensor is designed with great accuracy and quality for both industrial and home safety monitoring. It uses electrochemical technology to detect harmful carbon monoxide (CO) gas. This sensor is small, lightweight, and affordable, making it easy to use in different monitoring and safety systems. It is durable, lasts a long time, and can be used in a variety of settings, including factories, businesses, and homes.

whyChooseFeatures.title: Factory Tested
whyChooseFeatures.description: Each sensor individually tested and calibrated

calibration.title: CO Sensor Calibration Guide
calibration.description: Step-by-step calibration process to ensure accurate CO measurements in your application.

whatIsSection.title: What is Carbon Monoxide (CO)?
whatIsSection.description: Carbon monoxide (CO) is a colorless, odorless, and tasteless toxic gas. It is produced by incomplete combustion of carbon-containing fuels such as gasoline, natural gas, propane, coal, and wood. CO is dangerous because it binds to hemoglobin in the blood more readily than oxygen, reducing the blood's ability to carry oxygen to vital organs. The main sources of CO include vehicle exhaust, faulty heating systems, gas appliances, generators, charcoal grills, and blocked chimneys. Proper ventilation and CO detection are essential for preventing carbon monoxide poisoning.

lightMode.title: Electrochemical Technology
lightMode.description: The CO sensor uses electrochemical gas sensing technology to detect carbon monoxide in the air. Our monitors use a special sensor to detect carbon monoxide (CO), a deadly gas that cannot be seen or smelled. This CO sensor works using a simple chemical process. It has two key parts called electrodes and a special material that connects them. When CO enters the sensor, a chemical reaction happens. This reaction creates a tiny electric current. The more CO in the air, the stronger the current. By measuring this current, our sensor tells us exactly how much CO is present. This helps in preventing carbon monoxide poisoning and keeping the air safer for everyone.

sensorChip.title: CO Detection Module
sensorChip.description: High-performance electrochemical cell with integrated electronics for precise CO measurement.
